item.title: [ 81] Coping that this is like Madoka Magica and the writing is purposely shallow.
item.description:
I want to try and be brief with this because not only do I think this wont be receieved well, but I am (arguably) jumping the gun a bit because I havent finished it yet, but that fact will be part of my point.

The scene of picrel is essenitally the "conclusion" of the mini "conflict" that happened prior on the bridge before the boss fight. Even during that cutscene I was shaking my head a bit (figuratively).

Let me explain myself, and first say, that I am objectively correct even if you dont understand. But it is possible I am wrong overall, which is what I want to inquire about.

If this bit of dialogue is essentially saying that Maelle has accepted a reason to keep moving forward (No evidence of her ever coming close to suicide so its just about pure motivation to keep going on with the journey).

Then what the fuck was that whole freakout prior? She essentially got mad over nothing, and yelled at Verso because she felt he should have understood her grief since he had buried multiple expeditioners. Or lashing out at Lune and Sciel for just being able to "move on" as if nothing happened.

What did she expect to happen? She doesnt want condolence as she explicitly lashed out at Verso for trying that. And she obviously didnt want to stop the journey since picrel is literally a statement on her going on, even if Lune says it. And the problem neither was an inability to put Gustave to rest since they were literally on their way to bury him.

So what is my point? It doesnt make sense. Her actions have to make sense. Because I know some dumb fucking retard is going to say "WHEN DA TRAUMA PPLS NOT ACT DA REASONABLE YOU DUM DUM" but not only is this fucking retarded. But its BAD writing because what it means, is that if the conflict doesnt need to make sense, then neither does the resolution.

[Continued Below]

Original filename: 1746409006189025.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [205] /pcbg/ - PC Building General
item.description:
>UPGRADE & BUILD ADVICE.
Post build list or current specs including MONITOR: https://pcpartpicker.com/
Provide specific use cases.
State BUDGET and COUNTRY or you will NOT be helped.
Building guide: https://wiki.installgentoo.com/index.php/Build_a_PC

>CASE (from $ to $$$)
mATX: Asus Prime AP201, Lian Li A3, O11 Air Mini
ATX: Phanteks XT PRO (ULTRA), Montech AIR 903 Base/MAX, Lian Li Lancool 207, Antec C8, Antec Flux Pro
AVOID: NXZT, 'Silent' cases, fanless cases, Corsair 6500

>CPU
Budget: 9600X, 7600X, 7500f
Gaming: AMD X3D
Workstation: 9950X, 9900X
AVOID Shittel

>COOLER
AIO: Best Value: Thermalright Frozen Prism, Premium LCD: Corsair iCUE H150i ELITE LCD XT
Double towers: Thermalright Phantom Spirit 120 SE, Noctua NH-D15 G2
ITX/>42mm RAM: Scythe Fuma 3/TR AXP120-X67

>MOTHERBOARD
Avoid ASRock for Zen 5 due to a melting issue with a currently unknown cause that is happening more frequently on their boards.
Zen 4 is safe

>RAM
Gaming: DDR5 2x16GB 6000CL30
Workstation/high end: consider 2x32GB

>SSD (OS drive)
Mid range: SN770
Premium: SN850X
Flagship: SN8100

>GPU
1080p: RX 9060 XT 16GB, Poorfag Esports Gaming: Used GPU between $150-$250
1440p: RX 9070 XT, RX 9070, Budget: RX 9060 XT 16GB
4K:Used RTX 4090, RX 9070 XT
Workstation: Used RTX 4090 or RTX 3090
AVOID RTX 50 Series: False advertising "5070=4090 performance!!", unsafe power connector, broken drivers, overpriced compared to RDNA 4 in most regions, threatening reviewers, manipulating and faking reviews, evil anti-consumer company etc.
ALWAYS pair AMD GPUs with AMD CPUs for SAM https://imgur.com/a/6XSNJ9b

>PSU
https://hwbusters.com/best_picks/best-atxv3-pcie5-ready-psus-picks-hardware-busters/

>MONITOR
https://www.rtings.com/monitor

>OS
Activate Windows @ >>>/g/fwt

>CASE FANS
Case with good stock PWM fans

>Sick of DLSS cunt and his spam?
4chanX Filters: https://pastebin.com/ydrXvPPQ

Previous: >>105366071

item.title: [ 61] The average person spends about $15 on coffee a day For a 5 day workweek thi
item.description:
The average person spends about $15 on coffee a day

For a 5 day workweek this is almost $75 a week for coffee alone!

Now think about it like this: If you make your own coffee, sure, it MIGHT be more expensive IN THE BEGINNING. But.... After a while. Once you have paid off the machine. It is much cheaper to buy store coffee and MAKE YOUR OWN. Resulting in much more savings.

So yeah, even though it LOOKS more expensive in the beginning, you can actually save A LOT OF MONEY doing so

Original filename: coffeebreakfast.png

>AVOID USING:
• Mainboard audio when using multi-driver pos

item.title: [ 56] Americans see bright future ahead
item.description:
New Harvard CAPS Harris poll report Americans are extremely optimistic about America (link: https://harvardharrispoll.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/HHP_May2025_KeyResults.pdf)
Highlights:
- for the first time since COVID, over 50% of Americans think the economy is strong
- 6pt swing upward in people's opinion about their personal finances
- GOP net approval +4%
- Democratic net approval -16%
- US military, police most well liked groups. Hamas, Russia, China the least
- economy and immigration are the most important issues
- plurality believe trump is not meeting expectations, but majority believe he's better than biden
https://www.masslive.com/politics/2025/05/new-poll-reveals-major-shift-on-trumps-economy.html
New poll reveals major shift on Trump’s economy

President Donald Trump’s approval ratings may be underwater, but a new poll shows the Republican president making an important gain.

For the first time since July 2021, a narrow majority of American voters believe the American economy is strong, according to the latest Harvard CAPS/Harris poll.

Fifty-one percent of the poll’s 1,903 registered voter respondents offered that sentiment, compared to 49% who said it’s weak. That puts it right in the poll’s 2.2% margin of error.

That’s still an improvement over last month, when voter sentiment cratered amid the launch of Trump’s trade war and his tariff campaign. In April, 46% of those surveyed said the economy was strong, compared to 54% who said it was weak.

A plurality of respondents, 42%, said they believe the country is on the right track. But the poll also found sharp partisan divisions, with more Republicans (76%) than Democrats (17%) and independents (30%) who said the same thing.

Original filename: 💪💪 trump.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [105] Kansas City trip report
item.description:
Hey frens, it’s your least favorite /ck/ poster. Welcome to my personal blog where I show pics of the food that I’m eating.

Today I’m visiting Kansas City and I’m going to try an Italian steak sammich and stuffed ravioli from Giovanis deli. I’ll be in your town until Sunday.

1st stop is Taco John’s in Kansas. I have not had this since I was a kid. Ordered a steak stuffed grilled taco and a spicy chicken & potato griller.

I love America and all of our regional fast food places.

item.title: [ 44] Top CBS executives quit
item.description:
The President of CBS News and the executive producer of 60 Minutes have have quit their jobs following the lawsuit filed against CBS for deceptively editing a 2024 Kamala Harris interview.
CBS is expected to settle the lawsuit soon.
https://thehill.com/media/5312467-cbs-executives-resign-trump-lawsuit/
Trump-related crisis deepens at CBS News

The departure of two top executives at CBS News in recent weeks has shaken journalists at the outlet and fueled speculation the network’s corporate parent will soon settle a high-profile lawsuit brought against the company by President Trump.

The resignation this week of CBS President Wendy McMahon came just weeks after that of “60 Minutes” executive producer Bill Owens.

The back-to-back resignations served as the latest sign that a brooding crisis for one of the country’s largest and oldest broadcast news networks is reaching an inflection point.

Though they did not mention Trump’s lawsuit explicitly as they announced plans to leave, McMahon and Owens made clear they were convinced they could no longer independently lead CBS, which has come under increased legal and regulatory threat from Trump’s administration.

“In some ways, it feels like Trump has already won this fight,” one Republican political operative told The Hill this week. “He wants to be covered positively by all of these networks, and this is a pretty clear sign his plan to intimidate is working.”

Trump sued CBS News and “60 Minutes” last fall over an interview the program aired with former Vice President Kamala Harris just days before she faced off with Trump in the November election.

As part of his $10 billion suit, the president’s attorneys argued producers for the program intentionally edited portions of the interview with Harris to cast her in a more positive, coherent light.

Original filename: 💪Trump.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 33] A /pol/cel walks into a bar...
item.description:
Man stripped naked, beaten with poles after calling people 'N-word' in Mississippi bar, police say

https://www.fox13memphis.com/news/man-attacked-after-walking-into-mississippi-bar-and-using-racial-slur-police-say/article_33d95bce-f26a-4284-85d4-161c04c692a8.html?utm_campaign=snd-autopilot

HOLLY SPRINGS, Miss. - A man was attacked after walking into a Mississippi club and using racial slurs, police said.

According to police, the attack happened at C.J. Lounge in Marshall County. Police said the man walked into the venue and started using the "N-word" when referring to patrons.

Officers told FOX13 that the man went to the hospital Wednesday, believing he may have a broken jaw. The incident happened late Saturday night. Police are trying to determine if the attack is a hate crime.

Holly Springs Police provided cell phone footage to FOX13, showing a Tippah County man who had been stripped naked. Police said the people who attacked him are seen pouring beer on him in the video. Seconds before that happened, police said the man was kicked and stomped on nearly every part of his body.

"The guy walked in, and he was very aggressive," said Miles Stone. Stone said he was at the club on Memphis Street late Saturday night when the incident happened. "Other guys in the area were listening, trying to remain calm. They asked him to leave quietly."

Police said the Tippah County man continued to call people racial slurs. In another video provided by Holly Springs Police, the man can be seen outside of the bar speaking erratically and throwing what investigators believe to be gang signs.

Original filename: cracker-slurs-stonetoss-comic.png

According to the television channel, the incident occurred at 9:15 p.m. local time on Wednesday (1:15 a.m. GMT) when they were leaving the Capital Jewish Museum. Several other embassy employees were wounded.

item.title: [110] Trump makes S. African president watch videos promoting baseless claims of ‘white genocide’
item.description:
https://www.cnbc.com/2025/05/21/in-a-tense-meeting-trump-makes-the-south-african-president-watch-videos-promoting-baseless-claims-of-white-genocide.html
What started as a friendly first meeting between President Donald Trump and South African President Cyril Ramaphosa quickly devolved after a reporter asked Trump about the U.S. decision to admit white South Africans as refugees.

Trump baselessly claimed that there was a genocide against white people in South Africa, which Ramaphosa and other South Africans have vigorously denied.

Wednesday’s heated meeting marks the latest in a string of unusually tense Oval Office meetings with foreign leaders. It comes amid heightened tensions between the U.S. and South Africa over claims by Trump and Elon Musk about the country’s racial equity laws, which prompted the U.S. to recently admit white South African refugees — while barring refugees from other countries.

Original filename: 108148819-17478472912025-05-21t170553z_759610822_rc2gmeavjynl_rtrmadp_0_usa-safrica.png

item.title: [ 38] High Times in Pai, Thailand
item.description:
Sup chucklefucks. Spent 3 weeks or so here last year and had the time of my life. Made hundreds of friends and thousands of memories. I'd like to hear your stories about this little hippie land. I'll go first.

>Be me
>Be Backpacker in Thailand
>Averaging 1 Chang every 25 minutes
>Hear about jungle tubing in Pai
>Take probably the worst bus ride of my life from Chiang Mai, there are literally hundreds of twists and turns on road. Don't even get roadsick and it was still bad.
>Dropped off in middle of city, walk over to hostel
>Immediately start making friends off the bat, many people from Tiny Hat Land, but overall good vibes.
>Get immediately invited to rave while checking in, go with friends I made in my dorm room.
>See a couple people from back in Bangkok, hell yeah
>Kissing all sorts of European hippie chicks, DJ is great, burning weed, living damn good.

Now, while this is all great, my dumbass gave my newfound friend my keys and said friend was equally as dumbass as I was. He put my keys right on my bed in my room. I had to get up on a table due to some stray dogs that were around the hostel. Even slept there for a while until a roommate of mine found me. Became known as the "Table Guy" for a couple days, but it was funnier as things continued. This was Day 1, and I have plenty more to share.

I know this place is loaded with the worst type of hippie backpackers, but I had a damn good time. I 1000% recommend it and recommend Revolution Hostel if you're looking for partying and the Circus Hostel if you want to LARP as a hippie for a while. Happy to share more about this little wonder.

Original filename: Good_Times_In_Pai.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 56] Southeast Asia has been absolutely awful ever since COVID ended. I've been trav
item.description:
Southeast Asia has been absolutely awful ever since COVID ended. I've been traveling to Southeast Asia and even living there on and off again since 2015. Had a girlfriend and even at one point considered going all in on buying a condo in Bangkok and purchasing an Elite Visa for Thailand back in 2019. Have also spent long periods of time in Vietnam and Indonesia. Thailand and Vietnam are what I'm most familiar with. Here's the run down on at least why Thailand is an awful place to live and even visit in the post-COVID era/2025:

>taxes on foreign earned income when staying in the country for over 6 months. Even if you have to pay no taxes, you now still have to deal with paperwork every year and potential fear of audits from the Thailand Revenue Department.
>prices have skyrocketed from inflation since COVID ended, you are now paying borderline European prices for a third world experience
>(no, still being "cheaper than the US" in not an excuse for value, everywhere is cheaper than the US these days- Japan was literally cheaper than Thailand back when I visited both)
>women, especially Zoomers, no longer like or desire Western men anymore, they are all into Korean/K-Slop trash
>blacks, redditor digital nomads, upper middle class liberal white women, degnerate weed smokers (Thailand legalized weed after COVID) and IRL streamers fucking everywhere, where as before there used to be none. The whole country feels like you are in the Bay Area California for all the wrong reasons.
>Mandated 90 day check-ins with your local immigration office, no matter the visa
>To start a business in Thailand, you can only own 49% of the business, the other 51% majority must be owned by a local Thai
>literal DEI hire, NEPO baby, Millennial woman, WEF Prime Minister- this is the direction the country is headed in culturally/politically

You guys are way too late to the party. Southeast Asia peaked in the 2010's, they're on their "progressive Obama era 2012" arc now.

Original filename: 1735740983582541.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 45] Hey voyagers, The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread
item.description:
Hey voyagers,

The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread open for suggestions:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/trv/ is a slow board, so don't expect immediate responses. CHECK THE CATALOG – you might find threads already discussing topics you're interested in.

Before asking for suggestions, tell /trv/ about your:
>Budget
>Interests
>Level of understanding of the local language(s)
This makes it easier to give quality advice. Of course, keep your posts travel related.

For all other matters:
General culture questions >>>/int/
Politics discussion >>>/pol/
Transportation discussion >>>/n/
Outdoors-related discussion >>>/out/

For more information about safety, planning and other miscellaneous topics, check out the pastebin:

GENERAL INFO:
https://pastebin.com/yR1SAr3s

Note: Discussions of prostitution or sex tourism are not permitted on /trv/.
